trans-unit.source: Contains advanced properties for key creation.
<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> objects contain properties.
Some properties must be added to a key when it is created.
Other properties can be added after the key is created.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters> class enables you to add properties to a key as it is being created.

You can do this by passing a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters> object that contains standard key properties, such as key storage provider (KSP), export policy, key usage, user interface (UI) policy, and parent window handle, to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey.Create%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object that is being created will be initialized with these values before it is finalized.
You can also add non-standard properties to a key by using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.Parameters%2A> property.
If you need to add properties after a key is created, use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey.SetProperty%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the key export policy.
For information about key export policies, see the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngExportPolicies> class.
An object that specifies a key export policy.
The default value is `null`, which indicates that the key storage provider's default export policy is set.
Gets or sets the key creation options.
The returned <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationOptions> object defines options that are used when you create a new <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object.
These options determine whether the key is created in the user or machine key store, and whether a new key should overwrite an existing key.
By default, if <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationOptions?displayProperty=fullName> is not specified, the key is created in the user store.
An object that specifies options for creating keys.
The default value is `null`, which indicates that the key storage provider's default key creation options are set.
Gets or sets the cryptographic operations that apply to the current key.
This property is used when you create a new <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object.
It specifies the usages (such as encryption/decryption, signing/verification, and secret agreement generation) that will be enabled on the new key.
A bitwise combination of one or more enumeration values that specify key usage.
The default value is `null`, which indicates that the key storage provider's default key usage is set.
Enables a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey"></xref> object to be created with additional properties that are set before the key is finalized.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters> class enables you to create a new <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object and initialize it with common properties.
If you must set additional properties on the key during its creation, follow these steps:
Create a new <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngProperty> object for each additional property that you must set.
Call the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.Parameters%2A> property to obtain an empty <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngPropertyCollection> object.
Add the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngProperty> objects to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngPropertyCollection> object.

Call the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey.Create%28System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters%29> method overload and pass the initialized <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters> object to it.
A collection object that contains any additional parameters that you must set on a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey"></xref> object during key creation.
Gets or sets the window handle that should be used as the parent window for dialog boxes that are created by Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes.
This property should be set if key creation causes CNG to show a dialog box.
The HWND of the parent window that is used for CNG dialog boxes.
Gets or sets the key storage provider (KSP) to create a key in.
An object that specifies the KSP that a new key will be created in.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.Provider"></xref> property is set to a `null` value.
Gets or sets information about the user interface to display when a key is created or accessed.
An object that contains details about the user interface shown by Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes when a key is created or accessed.
A `null` value indicates that the key storage provider's default user interface policy is set.
